text: Good coffee better than starbucks no line on drive thru.  Good service. Clean.good service . Will always come to have my coffee here

The coffee is so good and there's a convenient drive-through. If you haven't been in a while come back and see the new art displays. 

There's a doggie bowl outside for your pooch. 

A great local find!

Very nice atmosphere.  The staff wasn't very excited. She looked like she wanted to kill me. 

We got a smart cookie and blended green tea smoothie. Both were alright. 

The green tea smoothie tasted nothing like green tea. It tasted like she poured milk and blended and added a scoop of sugar. 

Not my favorite place to go. Went to Starbucks right after...

Coffee, latte, steamer, tea, chai, iced, hot all amazing.   

The sandwiches are super yummy.  My favorite is the Carlos. Chicken salad is amazing. Breakfast sandwiches are great too.  Skip the jimmy dean sandwich and opt for the house made stuff you won't be dissatisfied.  Don't get in a rush and be upset because they are taking a bit to get you your food or coffee they are busy and for a reason. It is worth the wait.

And for anyone that complains about the price. This place is not some super chain place. It is the definition of a small business. They dont have corporate buyers getting mass quantities of coffee for the cheapest prices. They don't buy meat and cheeses in bulk and many of the items are made in house.  

So sit back relax sip your coffee while enjoying the art (for sale) on the walls.  I would even suggest having a conversation with your baristas. Sure you may have paid a bit more for your superior latte (I haven't noticed) but it's worth it.

I went to this place expecting so much more, based on other reviews.  There was three employees working and one person in front of me in line.  We stood there for ten minutes before the lady told us she would be "right there", as they scurried around doing God knows what.  When she returned there were at least six people in line and from a customer service stand point, she seemed to care less. Prices are not bad and coffee was average.

I started going to Perk-up when they first opened in So-Hi and have had a love affair with their chai ever since. Moved to Summerlin a couple of years a go and I still stop in for one anytime I am down in the area. Dirty Chai and a mani/pedi at Highland Nails!  If you make it for lunch - try "The Carlos" croissanwich!

It's the perfect lil neighborhood coffee spot with a fireplace, cushy chairs, books, games, and free wi-fi. They also have a large table for small meetings and participate in community events.  Oh - and there is a drive-thru for convenience. So skip the national coffee chains and stop in to support your local small biz!
Great coffee, great staff, great (constantly changing) art on the walls, and great owners.  If I lived in Southern Highlands, I'd be here all the time.

This place is both hidden, and a gem - regrettably, not a gem for the coffee... It is a quiet place, with mediocre Wi-Fi, and plenty of room to study/work/hang out.

Other than the décor, almost every other part of this place seems 'phoned in'. The staff is not particularly enthusiastic.  Occasionally, they are a little frightening (and not in the cool way). The food seems as though it was picked up a Cosco and then microwaved. Most of the coffee drinks taste as though one could get them from Keurig machine.

It is always a hope that one finds an independent copy shop that is interesting, delicious, cool, and a hidden gem. Somehow, I feel as though three stars solidly manages expectations inasmuch is what you should expect from this establishment.

If the nearby Starbucks wasn't so spectacularly slow, I would suggest it. However, if you actually want an out of this world coffee shop experience head to either Sunrise Café (on Sunset), or Samba Latte (on Jones). Both deliver what you are looking for...

Discovered Perk Up on Yelp and want to spread the word! This place is full of love. Such a warm atmosphere, great quiet background music, and delicious coffee and food (homemade raspberry almond muffins anyone?) I've been to most other coffee shops around Vegas and I go out of my way to come here as often as possible. Their coffees are really unique- so bold and flavorful! My favorite thing to do is work on the couches by the sunny window. If you are looking for a new place, check out this gem!

I was coasting down the highway; you know, 106 degrees, feeling no breeze, with Glock sitting between my knees. It would seem that nothing could ruin my mood that day: listening to early Cash Money, steamrolled enough blunts to smoke out the IRS building and about to enjoy an expresso.

I paid $2 for my drink. The prices aren't bad, and they're competitive with the other inferior coffee shops around town. 

My expresso was sour. This means it was probably uncooked, or the machine improperly calibrated.

My lips curled upwards and started retracting into my orthognathic negro mug (F- you Alexander Graham of Prudential for denying a brother coverage).

This is worse than my experience at Starbucks, and I generally go into a mass market dump expecting fecal-grade products with a smile.

The novels they have here are laughable airport gift shop stock. 

Some closure: the service I received on that very day was extremely poor, and I mean derelict impoverishment and abject poverty. I felt like a Jew that walked into a 1970's country club in LA. 

I did not get a hello, but the prepubescent youth unschooled in gentlemanly ways did. From me, a customer. I don't expect a red carpet, and I'm not playing the Jessie Jackson race card here either, but treat a negro right, come on. I got a smirk from some tile-mopping apron-jerking prison pickle. I should have sat in Greensboro style and lit up a most contemptuous blunt.

Don't go here. Go to Desert Wind. They are top notch. By far the best I've had worldwide.

I am a frequent regular at Perk Up because of the delicious coffee/drinks/desserts,outstanding, friendly baristas, and relaxing environment. It's a great place to catch up with a friend,relax,read or have a study party in the suburbs of Vegas. 

 I recommend the black/white cookie, *Highlands*, or a regular coffee
Nice lil coffee spot tucked away in Southern Highlands!  Great service. Comfortable setting. I can typically grab a table and get some work done without the crowds.

I'm completely hurt and disappointed by the experience that I had today at about 11:00am.  My fiance and I stopped by for a quick coffee while we were on a dog walk. I loved coming here; food and drinks are always amazing. I saw a few dogs inside and so I asked the girl at the cash wrap(she had curly hair) if it was okay to bring dogs in.  She shyly asked me if they were service dogs to which I responded no.  This other women who came from behind the counter to talk to someone (she was shorter and older with short brown hair) proceeds to tell me "there are two service dogs in the building right now who are trained to rip your head off if you're lying."  I was completely taken back.  That was extremely inappropriate. The girl at the cash wrap asked me if she could get me anything. I let her know that what the other women said was completely rude and I walked out.  A simple "no" would have been fine. I would have just asked if I could get some water for my dogs. Why would you threaten me with violence for just asking if my dogs would come in?  I was definitely a regular here but I never want to come here again.

This is the epitome of a friendly, local, independent coffeehouse without the contrived pretentiousness of...ahem...other "conceptual" neo-grunge or slickly-hipster single proprietor places in town (ain't gonna name names...) Attentive, knowledgeable staff, a variety of seating options (everything from comfy chairs in front of a fireplace to 2- or 4-person tables for work/laptops and a large table with 10 chairs) and artwork on the walls that can be yours for the right price all round out the aesthetics.

Still, if the coffee was no better than Dunkin' Donuts or Starbucks, there would be no reason to drive past the Orange and Green Monsters to get here, no matter how pleasant the staff and surroundings. The good news is that the coffee is indeed worth the trip- drip coffee, particularly the Kona, is flavorful and rich, the lattes and cappuccinos are full-bodied and served with enough foam to blunt any harshness in the espresso (only once was this a problem) and the mugs and cups they use are well-balanced in your hand. I've not used the drive-thru yet so haven't had the paper to-go cups, but I'm sure they're fine in their own way. 

The only reason I cannot give Perk Up 5 stars is because I live too far away to make it a daily habit...but they're not to blame for that, and I'm there as often as I can be!

I love neighborhood coffee shops and I frequent Sambalatte. This coffee shop is right in my neighborhood,  and I couldn't wait to try it! My first visit was good, although the hot chocolate was ok.  I generally liked it. My second visit I ordered the hot chocolate, again, but this time I asked one of the Baristsas to do the little art in my cup. Instead of saying oh yes of course! She responded.. in a hot chocolate? Usually that's for lattes and you can't really do it in a hot chocolate. When she tried to tell me all of that I tried to explain to her, "oh they have done it for me in other places." But she still decided to talk over me. So I just paid for my drink and waited and she actually made a heart in my hot chocolate, which I did thank her twice!!! I work in customer service and I don't think it was right for her to explain to me why she couldn't do it and why it seemed wrong for me to ask that. Whenever I go to Sambalatte they do it without me asking and it's a sweet surprise every time! That's what I love about coffee shops and what I expected from this place. I was very disappointed with my last experience and I'm wondering how I will be treated the next time. 

Regarding other posts: Food selection is bare. I would like to see a variety of danishes, bagels and muffins. Maybe even cookies too! Customer service is non existent and while sitting on a sofa I could see underneath it hasn't been swept in a long time.
Tried their iced coffee, and it was water down in a little overpriced. A medium is more than Starbucks large. I haven't tried their food but will go back another time. Fast service.

This place is amazing! Coffee is way better than Starbucks, they have different and way more creative drinks. The Southern Highlands is my favorite! I also love that they have sugar free options for almost every drink on the menu! The staff was a little blah, made a few comments that could have either been taken as funny or rude. I didn't take it the wrong way, but some people might.

This place is awesome. Staff is really super nice. The artwork they display is pretty great, and something I wish I saw more of around town. The coffee is really tasty and they have a good variety of options. I'm a fan of the Raspberry Mocha. 

The location is pretty far from where I live, but it's located in a really safe/nice area. More green than I'm used to in this city at least.

Definitely worth checking out regardless of where you're at in town.
Great coffee with the perfect ambiance. Exactly like you would picture a coffee shop with a place to sit, read a book, and enjoy your coffee. Definitely a great place for a relaxing morning
Nothing special here. Coffee is Ok, but don't try the oatmeal.

Quick service, good coffee, the food offerings included hot breakfast like bagel sandwiches.  The breakfast was great and didn't come out of a plastic bag and get microwaved like that big chain cafe.  Service was outstanding!

One thing I miss about living in the northwest is the local coffee shops!  Vegas definitely lacks when it comes to coffee.  I am so burnt out on Starbucks.  Saw this cool place and decided to give it a try!  

Love how friendly the staff is!  They have such a good selection of fun flavored lattes!  I love how they have a drive-thru as well.  They also have punch cards.  Yay!  

Minus one star because I feel like the prices are a tad bit high.

This is a high quality coffee shop with great staff. I couldnt be happier that they opened this business in our community..If you love this community and respect small business, I urge you to try this place.  This place will become an extension of your home. Its a great place to relax and enjoy a premium beverage for less money than the big corporate chains would charge you.

I tried their minimally-priced coffee today and was delighted by the flavor! The service was impeccable--especially by Las Vegas' often-unfriendly standards. I liked the independent feel of the original decoration, equipped with a book rack, artwork and general "non-Starbucks" feel. I was most impressed with the service. I will definitely tell family and friends to try Perk Up! It perked me up! It must have, or I wouldn't be writing this!

This coffee is amazing! They have a big choice of different flavors. Definitely the best coffee we had in US. Owner is super friendly, customer service up to the task, and also sandwiches were great! I would recommend this place to anyone, especially coffee lovers.

I wish I could carry this place home with me to my L.A. Hood! The owner was friendly, helpful and warm. 
We loved the mint chip blended my daughter ordered.  It was hard to chose just one of her special latte's. We chose the Moroccan &  Trifecta, and loved them. If I lived here I'd work my way through the list.

The coffee is amazing!  Great flavor!  Plus they have tons of sugar free syrups to choose from!  The employees are super friendly and great at making sure you get what you asked for!  Hands down the best coffee shop I have ever been to!
Today I had green tea a banana a scone and ham & egg croissant sandwich always great and like always the best service love this place
Great service, very friendly and helpful. Tasty green tea latte! They have this chicken croissant sandwich that is SO tasty!
The coffee is okay but nothing special. The food is really good but overpriced. The staff is friendly. The place just seems mismanaged.

I always enjoy my drinks when I order, and the breakfast sandwich a friend ordered looked great with the fresh fruit. My complaint is the drinks are priced like any other chain, (large blended with whip is $6.50+) and the drinks that do not normally come with whip cream they charge an extra 50 cents. They also have a stamp card which is great when you remember!

They have great coffee and the atmosphere is nice. The price for one cup of coffee was perfect, not cheap BUT definitely not expensive. I only wish they were more closer, I'm over 40 miles away from them. But their coffee is worth it and when I'm in the south part of town I make a special trip to Perk Up. So yes stop here for great coffee.
Found this little gem while heading out for a hike. Very friendly service, clean, and simple menu. Loved the Robin's Neat special! Cappuccino was tasty. Highly recommend this nice neighborhood stop.

**STAY AWAY** Wow! Service here is horrible.  Stopped by here on our way back to LA and thought we would patronize a small business.  The guy helping us was nice.  We ordered a black coffee (which was not good and watered down), iced tea, blueberry muffin and bagel.  The guy who took our order gave us our drinks right away, but he got busy with other orders and the drive thru and forgot about our food.  There was only two people working in there and it seems their priority is the drive thru orders.  As we stood there for 8 mins (come on, how long does it take to toast a bagel!??) and waited patiently without saying a word as they helped other customers, the woman with short dark hair working there said in ear shot of us to the guy "what are these two staring me down waiting for!?" That's when the guy put my bagel in the toaster. First of all, we were not staring her down, we were standing/sitting there quietly looking at the art on the walls. Second, it is not our fault that the guy forgot our food, which was not complicated. Third, their coffee sucks and food seems to be store bought (not homemade).  Even Costco muffins taste better!! Don't waste your time and money on this place! Totally crappy ending to our Vegas weekend.  If your service is going to suck, at least have amazing coffee.

Stopped in here on my way out of town headed to LA.  Ordered an iced coffee from the young kid behind the counter who was friendly and quick.  Clean establishment, good location and great tasting coffee.
Delish! Great interior. Food is yummy. Staff is friendly. Fast drive through in the morning.

First try of this place was when the fiance thought I'd appreciate some sweet coffee beverage. It was sweet of him, but... The beverage didn't blow me away. The chocolate he asked them to add ended up being slightly grainy. You know that texture you get from poorly mixed cocoa powder or from store bought chocolate syrup? 
Gave it another try during a break from Black Friday shopping with the brother. I ordered the Jimmy Dean breakfast sandwich with sausage, and the pumpkin spice latte. I honestly forgot what my brother ordered. Just know that it was also a hot seasonal drink. Umm... He didn't enjoy it 'cause it tasted nothing like what was described, and the same sentiment honestly applied to me. 
Did enjoy the breakfast sandwich though, and the staff was nice.

Friendly staff, good atmosphere for relaxing and studying.

I got the Moroccan as an iced coffee which was a great blend of flavor that not one flavor over powered the other. Refreshing on a hot day. I got the large and it was only 5.15 which I think was a great deal!

I definitely will be coming back and I woukd recommend this place to everyone.

**REGULAR CUSTOMER DISAPPOINTED** Customer Service needs to be worked on BIG TIME! 

My scenario as I write this. I've been here since 10am this morning and bought 2 pumpkin spiced lattes, 2 hot chocolates, a plain bagel, iced coffee, Chocolate chip scone (brought my older daughters with me & my husband) and we've been sitting enjoying the shop and doing some work.  The girl mixed up our drinks but we figured it out after a couple of sips. 

Lunchtime rolls around...getting hungry lol and I place an order with ARI(?) for a medium iced tea and THE CARLOS sandwich at 12:55pm and received my food at 1:23pm. 28 MINUTES LATER!! No word until I walked up front and she saw me, then said it would be a few more minutes. When she brought my food, she had her head down the whole time and whispered, "You're Welcome".. which I didn't hear but my husband said she did. He pointed out the fact that  she didn't apologize for the long wait, or mention it at all and didn't even smile when she put the food down on the table and quickly walked away. 

I'm fed up, that's why I'm writing this. I don't think we'll come back. There are other options. It just seems to me that these girls that work here are in their own world and just collecting a paycheck.  No effort to do things right. They don't write down the orders, so if they are inundated with orders, or get a lot of people in drive-thru and in shop...that's not a good thing. They don't pay attention to detail and if the owners not here, that's very evident in all aspects. No music playing, dishes on table, floors dirty, attitudes, etc. 

I believe I've been very fair & honest as my first review here was five stars and I've been REALLY trying hard to make it work because I see the potential of where this shop could go in So Highlands but if they don't care, then I guess I don't either. I'm out. 

Edited:

Service improving, tried them and recently again (I believe in 3rd chances) and all was great. Much better!

If you're coming here for smoothies then you probably don't want to come here. I'm sure their coffee is awesome and they are known for that but we got the Smart Cookie smoothie which was really good, you can't go wrong with that but my friend got a green tea smoothie and it tasted a like a vanilla smoothie with a hint of green tea. My other friend got a Wild Berry smoothie and it came straight from a box. Not a real fruit smoothie. Probably won't come back here.

Better than the Bucks!
Unique flavor
Great combinations
Perfect for a neighborhood spot if you're running to the golf course etc. give them a shot! Support your locals

So, I'm not an espresso expert. I like my coffee light and sweet, and then add another packet of sugar. I think this quaint little coffee shop offers a few things that most chain shops don't; they care about product quality, don't mind whimper when you make a special request, and really care that you enjoy your beverage. Why else would they offer ~20 flavoring a and allow you to customize your own beverage?

This is what we had;
Ice Blended Date Night: white chocolate and strawberry. I thought it was pretty good, all the flavors I expected were present except that the espresso flavor was fairly weak.

Ice Blended Trifecta: marshmallow, white chocolate, and macadamia. This drink was awesome! It wasn't overly sweet like I was expecting. 

Both ice blended drinks were really smooth and icey. There were no chunks of ingredients (chocolate or espresso beans), which means nothing to get stuck in your teeth. I might stop by again soon to try a latte or cappuccino- I think cappuccinos are really the way you can tell a good coffee shop from one that serves junk or doesn't know what they're doing, but my overall first opinion is a solid 4 star place- my next stop in will determine if it's worth the extra star.

Free wifi!!

The location of this place is somewhere I didn't even know existed--it was clean, quiet and something you would see in a movie or a Lifetime original series. ¯\_(?)_/¯

The actually coffee shop was cute and had it's own mis-matched charm. The staff was super friendly, and attentive afterwards, when you already got your drinks and have been hanging out for a while. I got a tiramisu latte over ice with almond milk---it was a little too sweet for me, but it was still very good and creamy, as if they used breve instead of almond milk, but I'm not complaining. And my boyfriend got a hot Moroccan latte with whole milk, which he really enjoyed and actually finished it in 5 minutes after getting it.

They have a really good selection of books and board games you could choose from and a cute little fireplace and some couches, for you to hang out and socialize. I imagine this place to be a cute coffee shop date during the colder seasons because it was so homey in there. 

Perk Up also has a drive-thru which is super convenient for those on the run, and from just sitting in the lobby for while, it seemed to be much more busy than the lobby. 

The restrooms were super fancy. (I just had to note that because they seemed like something you would see on HGTV.)

Two downsides though:
1.) the couches available were uncomfortable. :(
2.) the cashier who took our orders kept repeating back our order wrong, which happened 3x--fortunately, when we got our drinks they were right. It was just a little annoying having to repeat ourselves multiple times.

Other than that, I see myself coming back.
So many flavors to choose from. The staff was very friendly and it's a nice place to spend a Sunday morning relaxing and chatting with a friend.

Ran in here on a whim while waiting on my car wash next door. Ordered a medium iced Caramel macchiato, it wasn't layered with a caramel drizzle like it should be, it was all stirred together. Decent tasting drink, not as good as Starbucks, but good enough that I would come when I'm at the car wash again.

+ Neighborhood coffee shop convenient for residents
+ Menu includes regular, specialty, and blended drinks, & a few foods
+ Location has a drive thru and local art 
+ Cozy atmosphere with books, games, and local publications

Wish this spot had a location closer to my side of town because I would definitely go. The Sweet and Spicy coffee drink was nice, something different. Their coconut specialty drink was comparable to the Kokomo at Dutch Bros.

Randomly decided to try the coffee shop right by my house and surprisingly it was delicious! Simple nice coffee shop with so many selection and such great taste! Honestly the marshmallow flavor is watch reeled me in!
SUPER YUMMY breakfast wrap.  Delicious regular coffee.  Peeps on computers, folks reading papers, old guys chatting in the corner...  a very cool place to hang out on a Saturday morning.
My go to and highlight every morning before going to work!!! Their coffee is outstanding and the quality of service is so much better than your average Starbucks!!

I ordered a gingerbread latte at the drive thru this morning and it was wonderful. Great drink, service was quick, and the employee who assisted me was very friendly. I couldn't ask for better service or product from a local coffee shop. I will definitely be back again.

This place is so much better than Starbucks. The food is fresh and the coffee tastes better. Most of the food made to order as opposed to arriving pre-made in a big truck and then heated in a microwave. The staff and owner are super friendly and warm. The atmosphere is awesome--games, great seating, free wifi, art for sale on the walls. If you sit outside they bring your food to you. It's not a crazy zoo with hoards of people waiting and the service is so much faster than the Starbucks down the street. Support local businesses! :-)

I'm all about supporting local coffee shops, especially when the people who work there are kind and the coffee is great! And you can't go wrong with a little library, am I right?! 

The space is small and quiet so great for studying or getting a little work done. As for the drinks, I would recommend trying one of the fun lattes as they have many to choose from.

We just moved over to the Southern Highlands area and I was looking for a coffee shop that wasn't Starbucks. I drove past this place 2x before stopping in and I'm so glad I did! They have all sorts of drinks from tea and coffee to root beer floats. They also make their own scones in house and I have to say they are the best I've ever had!! I love the chocolate chip one. I really appreciate the fact they have almond milk and not just soy. The staff is so friendly and will give you awesome recommendations. The decor inside is also very cool and comfortable. I really enjoy this place and I'm so glad I found it!

As much as I hate to give up the secret of this gem, it is hands down one of my favorite places to study in Vegas. Quick wifi unlike other crowded coffee shops and plenty of table space and OUTLETS!! Family friendly environment and you will always see familiar faces from Southern Highlands.  

They have a great atmosphere with games, books and local artwork. Every latte your heart could desire and yet still I always want mine a little different. The baristas always give recommendations and bring everything out to you. I have to stop myself from eating all the fresh baked goods.. So tasty :)

Every friend or family member I have brought here falls in love. My mother doesn't drink coffee and still found something she enjoyed and was able to relax and read a book. You can't do that at Starbucks...
The owner was prompt in response of my previous review. She was courteous in apologizing for my experience at her establishment.

Stopped here on our way back home from Vegas. I ordered a green tea latte, and it hit the spot. Not too sweet, which can happen to me with chai lattes. Food itself was decent also, but not a lot of selection. 

Mainly, though, I wanted to compliment James for manning the drive thru and customers inside by himself. It would have helped him to have someone with him for sure. Regardless he was helpful and super efficient given the amount of people he was catering to.

Being very close to my job is a huge bonus for this place.  The prices are a little more than I think they are worth, but the quality and friendliness of the staff is solid.

I recommend their green tea smoothies or lattes here.  A little on the sugary side, but overall the flavor is fantastic.  Haven't tried the food items yet, but I do plan on it.

Got a free coffee coupon for this place from my community when we were moving in and I gotta say, this place is pretty darn tasty.  The coffee is great and the coffee shop itself is well decorated with plenty of space.  Its my new go-to coffee place, I just wish they were opened longer.

It is nice to have a cute local coffee shop so close to home. I don't live in Southern Highlands but I was housesitting on this side for ten days and stopped by Perk Up a few times instead of Starbucks. The days didn't come, I just made coffee at the house. If I lived in the house I am sitting for, I would come here for all my coffee needs. Which reminds me, the first time I came I tried to pay with my Starbucks app! Embarrassing. In the same trip, I also knocked over their stack of water cups. I almost never wanted to come back just for those two things, but they were kind about it! In my defense, I was very sick that day, I don't know if it was a bug or what but when I got back to my car I was so dizzy I could hardly drive. I had to take the day off and recoup. 

Anyway, enough about how I embarrassed myself! I'll start with the positives about the Perk. It was never packed, and the atmosphere was always comfortable . Some days seemed busier than others, but I was always able to find a seat and table. My dirty iced chai tea latte was to die for, I am writing this while I am in the store and I'm already thinking about getting another. The iced cups are nondescript, which I personally like because it feels noncorporate. I'm not a rebel but I enjoy supporting local businesses where you can meet the owner and know where your money is going. Speaking of, I love the "local" feel here, it's almost like the coffee shop in friends (of course, that could just be because they both have 'perk' in the name). The owner came around a few times while I was working on my laptop and asked if everyone was doing alright, which was a bonus. 

As far as negatives, there aren't many, so much of these will just be nitpicking.The clear glass by where you order is never full, which looks weird. Getting some fake food and filling up half of it to be a display would help the overall atmosphere when ordering. I wish I couldn't see as much of the back house stuff as I can because then you can see them making your sandwich with a microwave. I don't mind it, but it takes away the mystery a little! You can also see some shelves in the back. If a curtain can't be put up to block the back from the front, maybe some organizers could be utilized to make the shelf look spiffy. But if those are the only flaws I can find, I think that also says something about how cool this place is!

I love this coffee shop because #1 - it's local and not Starbucks #2 - they have some great drinks (my favorite is the iced white moroccan) #3 - I love going in and eavesdropping on a group of regulars, older men, that meet to talk about life and the world #4 - it's not Starbucks.

Coffee is ok. I only go here because the Starbucks near me is always so packed. I always buy there large but it is a small large. I'm paying more than I do at Starbucks for less? The hot lattes could be better. I enjoyed the cold lattes more but again they are super small compared to anywhere else, especially when you are paying 4.75 plus tax. One of my biggest pet peeves they drive thru is that when you pay with debit card you enter pin in there machine but then they have you sign a copy as well. The reason for them to have you sign it is so you can add a tip. First it's a drive thru and second I'm way over paying for your small coffees. Why would I tip? It's inconvenient and unnecessary. Add a tip jar if you want to get tips. The food... the yogurt parfait don't get pumpkin. It's awful. The regular one who be perfect if they actually defrosted it. When you eat the fruit in it it is frozen so it's hard to actually eat right away. No ones trying to break a tooth on the darn strawberry. The inhouse sandwich again could be better. Instead of cooking all fresh they make fresh toast but then use heated up jimmy Jones sausage and eggs. Like so close but still disappointing. I want to love this place but they step up if they want to beat Starbucks. I would rather buy from a mom and pop store than a local chain, so I am rooting for this place to find i
I had vanilla latte and a sandwich. Food and latte were both good. But it's over priced and customer service was bad. But it's quiet and good to relax and have coffee there.

Thank goodness I stumbled upon this coffee shop in my neighborhood. Such great choice of coffee flavors, and the baristas will make it according to your preferences. I tried the Tiramisu latte. This isn't the best I've had, but pretty good considering the choices in the area. Going to go back to try more flavors!

This place is amazing! So quaint and yummy! I had no idea how cute it was inside. They have comfy chairs with little tables, a long table with chairs you could easily have meetings at, breakfast & lunch items that are so good, board games to play  and books to read! Free wi-fi too. I had the chicken salad sandwich on a croissant, best chicken salad I've ever had.  
Not to mention the wide variety of coffee drinks and teas!! Definitely a must go!!

First time here wanted to try a local coffee shop I order a sugar free vanilla latte and tasted like vanilla milk so I went in to ask for another shot of espresso and the girl behind the counter was very rude and condescending I wish I would have got here name. First and last time going here
I thought this coffee shop was awesome before I meet Jeanie. She was very rude and dressed like she just woke up in those clothes. For her sake I hope she loses some weight soon.

This is our favorite coffee shop. The staff is always so nice and welcoming, we love the sandwiches, and the coffee drinks are delicious. The iced green tea is perfect and much better than Starbucks. We would go here over Starbucks any day!

I recently moved to Southern Highlands and decided to give this place a try. I'm a coffee lover and this place is ridiculously close to my house, yay! They have sugar free flavors that many others don't (i.e. SF white chocolate, SF Irish cream...). They're so delicious! The girl at the drive thru is friendly and remembered me from the day before on my second visit! I am sure this will be a regular place for me!

Love this coffee shop.  I don't just support them because they are local- I come from a land of coffee worship (PDX) and can honestly say the coffee here is top notch.  Maui Nights- YUM!  Good iced or hot.  What more could I ask for- great coffee, nice people, cool art, classic local coffee shop.  Love coming here to read or hang outside with my dog.  Support local art & coffee!

Great little spot in the neighborhood to sip a tasty tea, or coffee, and visit with a friend. I've been here several times, and it's always peaceful, with comfy, oversized chairs to sink into, and friendly staff to take our order.
Why is this place not busier than Starbucks?   It's great.  I highly recommend trying this place as an upgrade from Starbucks.
Cute, quaint, and feels like home! Best thing on the menu is chicken salad on a croissant! They also have many yummy coffee options and the staff is very friendly!

Great service, good coffee and delicious food! Makes me feel at home like our small shops in LA.  The staff is friendly and inviting. The robins nest breakfast sandwich is a great bang for your buck. I would've put a picture but I ate it too fast.

My boyfriend and I are coffee addicts so it's great to have someone come with me to try new coffee shops....especially local ones. They got a ton of coffee/latte concoctions here and the price is right. About $4 and some change for a medium iced latte. 

Mine was called "Colada" because there's white chocolate and coconut. You can request it any way you like. I'm not a fan of overly sweet drinks so I got half the sweetness and it was made perfect. Not overly sweet, but just enough flavor to know there's caffeine with a hint of white chocolate and coconut. My boyfriend got a "Sugar & Spice." I think he had chocolate, hazelnut and cinnamon in his drink. He loved it!

They have a stamp card too. Definitely will be back! Can't wait to see what kind of autumn season special drinks they'll have! =)

We were in Southern Highlands, looking for a place with Wi-Fi... 

We found one, Perk Up.. Since I'm always excited to try something new, we rushed right in. 

At first when I looked up at the menu all we saw were coffees & teas. They also had a display case that had muffins and sweet rolls, and slices of quiche. 

I finally looked to the right and there was a stand up menu chalk board that offered some breakfast & lunch options. 

I ordered some tea then decided I wanted lunch.. I asked about a couple of the sandwiches and the girl at the cash register was great in describing some of the offerings and even mentioned how she had pumpkin muffins coming out of the oven. YUM! 

I ordered the quiche, which came with a side of fruit. Once served the quiche was good, but I've had better, the small portion of fruit looked as though it had saved from last week, perhaps so since it was a Monday. My friend had mentioned that the fruit did not look appealing and most likely was a couple of days old. They immediately cut up some fresh fruit and brought it out to us. 

Nice, clean place with great service. It's not a place I am craving to go back to for lunch, but to meet for coffee or tea, you betcha!

Love Perk Up. It's one of my favorite coffee shops to relax and get some work done. I used to live in Southern Highlands and got a lot of school work done here. It's quiet and has lots of comfortable chairs. I now live in San Francisco, but visit Vegas often. When I'm in town, i always stop here and get my favorite drink, the Highlands Latte. Perk Up is also the last stop before the drive back to California. Recommend fueling up here, before the long drive back to Cali.

Great coffee, great service and great atmosphere. The homemade pastries are fantastic. I don't want to overstate it, but the peach turnover I had was one of the best pastries I've ever had. This is a great local cafe, an excellent find.
Wow i had a iced vanilla lattee. And a home made macadamia and white choclate cookie. Omg i have a regular client out here. Imma come every time. Just yummi!

I came here for a cup of joe before I head back to LA but the ambience was so inviting I decided to pop a squat and read up on some Desert News but first, check in to Yelp, my favorite thing to do.  I mostly post pictures and don't normally post reviews but 2018 will be the year I exercise my voice.  The decor has books and artwork for sale which for this nerd, kinda my jam.  I want to stay all day and read but here I am writing a review.  

So as I was following the prompted cues for checking, I was looking around and my eyes landed on their Robin Nest special, which consist of toast, 2 eggs, avocado, tomato, spinach, onion, mushroom and Bacon for $9.95.  I was originally just going to check out another place to eat but everything seems North and I am headed South.  And boy am glad I ordered it because it's good.  It's more of a knife and fork sandwich.  Def hearty bc I am full and I still have 1/4 left.  You can choose btwn a croissant (my first choice but they ran out), bagel, white or wheat toast.  I just picked white.  I'd prefer mine toasted more but other than that, it was great.  Which leads me to why I am writing this review...oh before I get into it, coffee is decent.  Personally I like a darker roast.  But the menu typical of coffee shop, coffee, expresso drinks, blended drinks, scones, bagels, breakfo (served all day) and lunch (sandwiches and salads).  Oh and they cater.

So why I am writing this review?  Well I have been a a server/bartender for too long to admit and the barista/cashier/cook was friendly and service oriented.  I brought in my own coffee mug, yes people we NEED TO REDUCE, REUSE & RECYCLE, but it had left over coffee from yesterday so sticky and gross.  I was just going to rinse it out myself but the restroom was occupied.  But it's not just the concept of him washing it but can do attitude he had about it.  When I approached him about ordering breakfast I was surprised he was also the cook while running the front of house AND drive thru all simultaneously.  And there's been a steady stream of customers and he's multi-tasking like a pro.  If I owned a place, I'd hire him asap.  So thank you Adam (dirty blond hair with glasses) for your service.  I wish this was my neighborhood coffee bar.

I was looking for a nice, quaint coffee shop with free wifi and comfortable seating.  The pictures I saw on Yelp pointed me to Perk Up Coffee Shop.  I'm writing this review during my first visit in the middle of a Saturday, so my experience may not be representative of a more regular customer.

I showed up around 1130 in the morning and the place was empty.  The staff was very friendly and greeted me upon entry.  I got oatmeal and black coffee.  The oatmeal was delicious, but the coffee was a little watered down.  That may have been due to the odd time of day, but that's the main reason I'm docking the place one star.  The other reason being that, while I enjoy the decor and overall feel of the place, there aren't enough large tables.  There's one 6-person table, but the small tables could be just a little bit larger.  Can't really spread out for studying/working purposes very easily.

Otherwise, I think Perk Up Coffee Shop is a great little place on the Southwest side.  I'll definitely be back.

Checked this place out on my way to meet a friend.  As a vegetarian I was sure what to order.  The gal working the drive through suggested a number of items they could customize for me.  I ended up with a vegetable omelet which was delish!  Ty Perk Up Coffee Shop for having a great employee who makes personal recommendations.

I very much enjoy going to this coffee shop. The staff is very friendly and they provide excellent customer service. One experience, in particular, was earlier this morning. I had ordered a bacon, egg, and cheese on a croissant. The young lady behind counter asked me if I minded waiting, since there was a sandwich ahead of me. I told her no and waited. Turns out, something unexpected happened and the wait was a little longer. I didn't mind this, since everyone was so nice. The same lady behind the counter came back with my sandwich and said that they would refund me. I HAD MY MEAL FOR FREE! I really appreciated this, especially since circumstances concerning the wait weren't  really their fault. Perk Up is definitely one of my fave coffee shops

I was really excite to try Perk Up. I love to see places like this opening up. Las Vegas needs more independent coffee shops.
However, I was a bit disappointed with the quality of the coffee. My latte was really nothing special. It had that standard "restaurant with an espresso machine" taste. Minimal, thin foam, with no crema-milk contrast. I tried a sip of my girlfriend's toffee latte, and it was really chemically and artificial. Also, it was served in a to go cup when we were obviously staying in the shop.
I really wanted the coffee to be awesome, or at least what you would expect from a shop with this image/appeal. So much potential! The place is spacious, gorgeous, and comfortable, with a fireplace and many comfortable chairs and seating areas. 
Overall, this shop has a lot of room to grow. Try using different, higher quality beans, train your baristas to make coffee that is memorable and "worth the drive", and ditch all of the flavored syrup pumps. If you are going to offer boutique/dessert flavors, find a way to do it that doesn't sacrifice quality so much. You cannot create an amazing coffee shop without amazing coffee!

Perk Up is an absolute hidden gem in Southern Highlands! The staff is very friendly, the atmosphere is relaxing, and the coffee is wonderful! This is by far one of my favorite neighborhood coffee houses in the city.

The staff is extremely friendly and the coffee was even better! I like how quaint and quiet it is. Perfect coffee shop if you are looking for one in Southern Highlands. I had a caramel iced macchiato and it tasted even better than what I get at Starbucks. Love it!

My new favorite spot after I have finally given up on the Starbucks in Southern Highlands with their 20 min drive thru wait times. This drive thru is fast the girls are sweet and the coffees are 100x better than starbucks. Inside is super cute and clean and food is excellent a must try if you haven't been.

I've had my last straw.  I will never go back here.  Every time I go, there is something new that sucks.  

   This time I found out that they

1.  Don't include a slice of tomato on your BLT (but will charge you .50 cents for adding 1 slice

2.  They charge if you want extra MAYO on your sandwich!!!!!   Another .50 cents.  

3.  They charge .50 for an extra small pickle slice

Are you kidding me!!!

The prices for a THIN small sandwich was already way overpriced at like $7.50, then you add another $1.50 for "extras".

I'm done.   Then because the price always sounds high, I asked for an itemized receipt after I paid and look at the pic I got!!!   Items listed, but no prices.  I had to ask to find out how much they ripped me off by.  

See pic of receipt and just how thin this silly BLT is. Ridiculous.

I'm so glad I found this little gem (thanks Yelp!). It's literally down the road from me and it's so nice to have a coffee option that ISN'T Starbucks. I remember my first time looking over the menu and ogling the tiramisu latte and deciding I needed it ASAP.

My lovely, darling, amazing husband ran out one Saturday morning to grab me an iced tiramisu latte with almond milk, and it was amazing. I decided I needed more, so on our way out of Vegas headed to California, we stopped by again and I got another latte. They have a drive through too which is ULTRA convenient. I forget exactly what I got, but there was chocolate and cinnamon in it. Again, incredible. 

I then stopped by the other day, yes I know I may have a problem, but I went inside and I love the decor! Super intimate and modern, I loved the book case and how welcoming the place felt. I ordered a blueberry muffin, which was served to me warm, and an iced caramel macchiato with almond milk. The service was fast and polite, and I enjoyed every bite of my muffin. 

Overall, I would recommend this place to anyone. They have really unique latte flavors and a good variety of food/snack options. Definitely stop on by if you're in the area!

One of my favorite coffee shops and it is right around the corner from my house! Super convenient for driving through on the way out, or to stop in while on a walk with the kids. They offer delicious drinks and tasty food choices. Inside they feature artwork from local artists giving it a true local feel.
We found this gem not realizing how close it was to us. Great customer service and interaction. Coffee was incredible and their Chai Tea was amazing. Can't wait to stop in again.

Waist of time. Always messing up my order. I've had to redo my order twice just today and they never seem to listen. It's sucks because some people there are so sweet, and then some staff just don't listen, or care to listen. I'm allergic to mushrooms and didn't even ask for mushrooms and they got in my sandwich???? I've asked for simple plain meals and when I get them I get "the works". They need to train their staff to listen to the customer. If the customer didn't ask for something in their sandwich DONT PUT IT ON THERE. simple as that. I don't know his name but the guy with brown long hair and glasses, I would listen to your customers more :)
Stopped in for first time today.  Will be back.  Instant fan.  Owner and staff are very cool.  Great choice for fresh coffee!

I can't believe I've never stop by here and it's right around the corner from my house.  Found my new coffee spot.  Got the buttermilk vanilla doughnut and a regular coffee with steamed almond milk and they where both delicious.

This really is a nice little coffee shop on Southern Highlands Pkwy; however, my first time in wasn't the greatest experience. I opted to meet up with a client here mainly because this was the best location geographically for the client. I came, I entered, and holy guacamole every single table was dirty, every one. The place was empty except for one customer in the far corner of the shop; instead of being able to sit down with my client at one of the tables where I would've been able to speak with them face to face, we opted to sit down at the cleanest table we could find in an awkward side-by-side position, but we made due.

I put in my order, and told the barista where we'd be sitting. Our meeting lasted about 25 minutes, and I still didn't have the coffee. After our meeting was over, I noticed my coffee was just sitting up on the counter top. Haha nice, they didn't even have the decency to bring it over to where we were sitting. The staff literally had nothing to do as the place was empty.

The chairs were comfy.

Ok..so i don't often do reviews.. For anyone.  But i have for the places that have really made me feel compelled to share with others what a great experience or amazing service i had. Perk-Up coffee shop is one of those places. My boyfriend and I came to Vegas for a bmx competition he is in at the South Point Arena.  We wanted to pick up breakfast that we felt might not come out of can and maybe have some someone putting it together with care instead of practically coming off of a conveyor belt like the places that were in close vicinity. I am a big advocate for supporting the smaller mom and pop or neighborhood coffee shops or cafes so i began my search online from our hotel to see where the nearest one would be.  I came across Perk-Up.. From the moment i placed the order i knew that this was the reason i go out of my way to purchase food from places like this as apposed to the main stream chains that most people flock to.  It ended up that the woman who took my order was the actual owner Jeanne.  In the short minute or so of placing the order she had me cracking up by her response to something dorky i said.  I made my way to her coffee shop that was located in the middle of a quiet neighborhood away from the craziness of Vegas. It was a little further than i expected but after i picked up my food i thought.. We will definitely be back here tomorrow.   Jeannie greeted me as soon as i walked in and just knew by the way that i walked in that i was the one who ordered the food to go. We talked and laughed a second before i left.  But i have to say.. It is so so nice that there are places like this coffee shop where the people working in it don't make you feel like a number but a customer that they value having.  I don't eat out often even when i am away from home.  I am a health nut working at getting my master's degree in nutrition. But if this Perk-Up coffee shop was in my neighborhood in Pasadena California.. I would probably be there every week!  Thank you Jeannie!  When i got back to my hotel i was telling my boyfriend about you and decided to check out your website a bit more. It now makes sense why the food was so good and the service so great! You don't even have to know about the impressive education and experience that she has under her belt.. It shows in how she conducts her business! We will be back.. For sure! :))

Cute and quaint little coffee shop - they have a huge selection of coffee. I chose the Nutella latte, which is one of the best I've had. It's a good place for a coffee date as it's kind of hidden and quiet, not loud inside, soft music and never really busy. I'd come back and try their other lattes. Customer service was good for me :)

Very nice and cute little coffee shop right in my neck of the woods.  The drinks I've had have been very good (the Highlands latte was delicious!) and I'm looking forward to trying more on the menu.  The girl that has been working on my last two visits was polite, but could maybe have been a bit more friendly.  Definitely recommend giving this place a try, it is great to support small local businesses too!

Anyone from Southern Highlands should support this local business. It has all the quality, none of the pretentiousness, and a better ambience than the nearest Starbucks, which is jammed between a McDonalds and a gas station. The artwork mentioned by the other posters is a cool idea, since it features local artists, and if you dont like it, they frequently change it! Ive always found the baristas to be quick and friendly. I go there for all my hot and cold drinks, and so should you.

Whenever I'm visiting a new place, traveling, I google "Coffee shops near me." I've found some of the most amazing coffee shops this way...I love it!

Driving from Denver, Colorado to Santa Maria, California took us through Las Vegas and we stayed with friends to break up the trip.

I chose Perk Up because it was on our way well past the traffic close to The Strip (otherwise I'd have gone to The Beat just off Fremont).

There were five of us and I'll admit that for a small place, we may have overwhelmed the place upon entering, but we stood there probably five minutes (seemed like 15) without anyone even acknowledging our presence. To be fair...there were only two women working. But that's part of the problem.

The emphasis seemed to be on getting the drive-thru customers' orders done and having never been there wanting food, drive-thru wasn't an option.

The food selection was meager, at best. My daughter ordered a pumpkin scone and it was just flavorless. There was no detectable sweetness in the scone itself and no glaze or anything on top...just a few sad sprinkles of raw sugar. My sister and niece shared an expensive, not-good sandwich.

The coffee wasn't bad, particularly. It just wasn't great.

Everything else that happened...the lousy food ($3 sandwiches were microwaved, other sandwiches were $8.50 and just not worth it), the neglectful service, the time it took to get the drinks. We won't be going back on our way back through.
I love this coffee shop! They have coconut almond and soy milk as options instead of milk. Plus lots of books and games

Had to write another review because they take down negatives reviews. Jeanne was extremely rude and very condescending I refuse to go back to that place and here are a couple pointers

Be nicer to the customer 
Dont take down negative reviews because you can't handle criticism
And hire a health inspector it smelled like there was a dying animal in the shop
Coffee is over priced for the way it tastes. I'll stick to dunkin donuts. On the other hand the sandwiches are very good

YUCK!!! Went through the drive through and ordered a peppermint mocha and a vanilla latte. They were both disgusting!!! VERY fake and artificial tasting. The peppermint mocha tasted like a packet of hot cocoa, with some fake peppermint flavor added to it, and maybe a shot of coffee. When I asked for some sugar for our coffee, she wanted me to give her a specific number that I would like. So I told he 6 and asked for a stirring stick. She looked at me like I had a dick growing out of my forhead. It's SUGAR!!!! Just give me a handful!!! I almost turned around and went back to ask for a refund, but I was on a time crunch to get to a birthday party. So I ate the $10+ that I paid for coffee we didn't even drink. Save your money, or go to Starbucks, because the price is the same :(

The first time I came here,I ordered a mocha coffee and a gooey grilled cheese sandwich. A mistake was made to my order and when I brought it to the attention to the manager, she comped my mask and offered to make me another!
The second one was perfectly grilled and perfectly gooey. It was just so delicious and is the perfect thing to bring you out of a weird funk of a day.
And let me day I really hate coffee.I'm more of a tea gal, but I really did like the coffee here.It's just so good!

Overall, the staff is super nice, the coffee is great, and sometimes I just really crave that delicious gooey grilled cheese! Come here!

This place is tucked away in the corner of the lot like a hidden gem. The shop has a nice sitting area outside to take in that morning dew with your coffee. Right when you walk in you notice a fire place with shelves full of books. If you don't like reading, there are little board games you can share with a group of friends. Sitting area is comfortable and along the walls. It sure does beat Starbucks in seating availability. I noticed they have a variety of syrup flavored to top your coffee; if you have a specialty in mind, they probably got it.  They do have a lot on their menu so take your time choosing lol. I will mention it is pretty pricy. I only ordered 2 coffees and a breakfast sandwich that came up to a total of $25. This is in my neighborhood so I wouldn't mind coming often. Maybe it'll grow on me. If your a stamp card collector for discounts, your in luck because they will give you one.
Awesome staff great coffee. You gotta try the Robins Nest breakfast sandwich.  Better then anything you've ever eaten south side of noon!

Just moved up the street and not a huge supporter of Starbucks. Found this gem and fell in love! So friendly and patient and even gave my pup a dog treat and made her feel more comfortable as she gets scared by new people. Beyond impressed. Plus a punch card and the coffee was AMAZING! This will be our new morning spot.
Forgot to mention.. Not only is the coffee good but the people up at the front who make the coffee. Melissa and Sarah... BEST company, and they make great coffee. Love love love coming here. (:

Best double dirty chai latte in Las Vegas! (I typically get mine with sugar free chai and nonfat milk.) The times I've ordered pastries or sandwiches, those have been good as well. I considered 4 stars because sometimes there is a bit of wait  (not today), but the awesome friendliness and quality of the coffee typically make up for it!

Its just OK as far as im concerned but im not the normal coffee customer either. I appreciate a place that allows you to sit and work, and linger for a while. I have the luxury of working from remote places and its nice to change the atmosphere from time to time and people watch as well. This place was tucked away in Southern Highlands and although its not bad i wouldnt make the trip to come hang here again. The seating is OK but doesnt feel super comfortable and there is even a broke chair here and there. Im simple and dont drink my calories so the typical Green Tea with Honey is my order and it was not bad. All in all not a wow i love it i gotta come back, but not terrible.

Nice local coffee shop that provides some unique flavor combinations. Good alternative if you're tired of the same old stuff at Starbucks. Staff is usually friendly and the indoor ambience feels nice. 

However, some of their food seems a bit overpriced. A bacon, egg, and cheese on a bagel costs $9.50 after tax not including any gratuity. That price markup seems a bit excessive. 

Good place for a quick coffee but definitely a pass if you're just looking for a good quick bite to eat in the morning or a complete breakfast.

Loooove this Little Coffee Shop! The ladies were Very Nice, and Accomodating to Me! They explained things I wasn't sure of, and Most of All it's Close to where I Live!

It is located in the Southern Highlands area, It's a little hidden...but it's on Valley View, and if you pass the Fire Station...you've passed it! Perk's is Connected with a Pizza Parlor (not sure of the name) but, also in the area is a Capriotti's, a Nail Salon and some other Shops!

The Shop itself is very Clean, and there is also outdoor seating if you are so inclined to Chill, and Relax for a bit! There is also a Drive-Thru for your Convenience!

You ask If I'll be back.....Ummm, YES! LOL

Atmosphere, comfort, good service, & great food. I love that the coffee drinks are served in mugs if you're staying in to enjoy the fireplace/complimentary books/comfy chairs or conference table space for large groups. I highly recommend this place!!

Their soy chai is delicious!  I usually put a pump of vanilla into it. It's also really good with the toffee.  The baristas are nice and it has a great vibe inside.  I also love the local art on the walls. This place is a wonderful local coffee shop gem

Very homey, you can also play games and read books while youre drinking / eating. They have a drive-thru which is great if youre in a hurry. The croissant wasnt good but their peppermint frappucino was better than Starbucks! Love this place

New to Las Vegas and moved to Southern Highlands. This community is family oriented and Perk up coffee is perfect place to relax and enjoy some coffee or drive thru and take to go. I found the flavors they offer are perfect and the customer service is ideal.

I stopped in today for the first time, and the cold blended beverage was awesome, the service was immediate, the place was warm, welcoming and clean, and my breakfast meal was outstanding. Try the Robin's Nest breakfast when you go, wow! I have nothing bad to say. I will be coming back.

Really good coffee, I just order drip..... But I worked in a coffee shop for 3 years it was hot fresh and property brewed.  If you can't make good drip, you cannot make any coffee drink well.

I  also ordered a bagel with cream cheese, very fresh and good.  The help was perfect! Nice  job!

I was envious of my friends in Summerlin because they had Sambalatte. And my friends in east had Sunrise. But now I'm glad that my neighborhood has our own (little) independent coffee shop. Although compact, Perk Up has good drinks, friendly staff, Wi-Fi and furniture to relax or mingle on. I've never sampled the food, however, they do look good. Drive-thru is available and for the most part, they're friendly and quick. It's a great alternative if Starbucks down the road is crowded.

I'm new to the area and those who are pregnant know that pregnancy craves can be severe and deadly in some case lol. I went in craving a chicken salad sandwich and let me tell you me and my baby are beyond happy. I'm so excited to have found a place that's close and satisfied OUR needs

Over the past 8 months, I have become something of a regular at the drive thru here. For starters, you can't beat the fact that it is cheaper than Starbucks, faster than Starbucks, closer to my house than Starbucks, and also (to me) TASTES better than Starbucks! The three girls who I always see in the drive thru are always so sweet, and they have incredible memory. They can remember my husbands coffee order when I can't! LOL! Seriously, if I forget to order him his coffee, the girl will remind me. And that saves me an extra trip! I love this place and the NON-corporate feel! I love supporting local businesses over big corporations, I think that's such an important thing to do these days!

Established in 2011, this independent coffee shop has been perking up the Southern Highlands coffee scene. Two times this month, I was a part of this scene. The two times that I visited, I was studying from the test prep guides that I borrowed from Enterprise Library. Regardless of the small number of Starbuck's closer to Enterprise Library, it was worth driving a greater distance to spend time to Perk up in a unique coffee shop. 

  What a coffee shop to Perk Up in. There is a versatility in seating arrangements. There is outside seats. Inside on the immitation wood floor are plush chairs, small tables with seats, stools at the counter, and a six person table. The six person table is the ideal spot for a meet up, and in my case getting acquainted with the testing material. But if I was into reading a book or chatting with a friend, I'd prefer the plush chairs at the corner near the library case. And if I didn't want to leave my car, I could use the drive thru. No matter where you sit, the Las Vegas sun shines and complimentary WiFi shines into Perk Up Coffee. 

  The changing art work really shines into Perk Up Coffee creating a unique and interesting environment. My two visits brought me back to the 8 bit Nintendo Era. Jeff Swenty's 8 bit wood and carvings adorned the walls of the shop. They are so cheerful. I'd look up from the six person table at wood and carvings of Raccoon Mario and the Power Up Mushroom. Near the library case, Donkey Kong was on display. Over the plush chairs, an 8 bit rabbit drew attention to that corner. On another wall was 8 bit Mega Man. On the wall of the corridor leading to the rest rooms, stood 8 bit Glass Joe from Mike Tysons Punch Out fame. This scene reminded me of the late Galaxy Cafe's attention to theming. I am going to miss Jeff Swenty's 8 bit wood and carvings when it's gone. 

   Cleaniness appears to be consistent. When the batistas wasn't helping customers, she was cleaning. From the tables to the restrooms, cleanliness was on display. 

  There was a large menu for me to choose from. For example, in the cooler months they also serve pumpkin spice latte, pumpkin chai, and pumpkin bottom muffin. I was up to perking up with a simple cup of coffee with flavoring. They offer a nice variety of coffee flavoring that includes marshmallow, Irish Cream, and strawberry. I went for the coffee with strawberry syrup. It was savory and inexpensive. With the flavoring, the coffee came to around $2. Refills were also inexpensive. If I was hungry, I might of ordered a pastry. 

  On both visits, the batista was friendly. Last time, she chatted with me about the 8 bit wood and carvings. 

  I give a shout out to Perk Up Coffee Shop. In very recent times, the Las Vegas metropolitan area lost three independent coffee shops: Galaxy, Coffee House of downtown Henderson, and Beanz. I will not take Perk Up Coffee for granted. I am perking up the word that this is a four star independent coffee shop that is clean, unique, and brews a variety of savory beverages.

Stopped here on the way back to San Francisco and the owner was so nice and welcoming. Many ppl (us including) just want to get something quick before going on the road but if you have 10 min to spare, I highly recommend this place. My soy latte with light ice was just that. Amazing flavor. And the Robin's nest sandwich was divine... The egg dripped thru my croissant (got no bacon and on a croissant) it was the music of all of the foods into one. Satisfying and homemade. The egg had a very nice golden yolk color (love my eggs haha). Great space too - if it was closer to me (I would have made it my go to study spot). But point is support local business and get some delicious food!

(4.5 stars) Really, really great coffee and crazy cheap at $2.40 for a large cup. It's a cozy, relaxing space although the service is slow. Although it's absolutely worth the wait for the coffee, there shouldn't be one person running the counter, running the drive-thru, making the coffee, and cooking the food.

I want to like this place. It's right around the corner from my house and is perfect when I'm in a pinch. Sadly, I think my visit today was my last. 

The first issue I have, which I've always had, is that they are incredibly slow. I get it, you are a small cafe with only one or two people working at a time with a drive-thru. But I shouldn't have to stand there for 10 minutes waiting to order, not because there is a line, but because you don't have enough people working and the priority is the drive-thru. I would let this slide if they acknowledged the delay but they don't. 

My second issue is their inconsistency when it comes to their food. You can get the most delicious egg sandwich one day, only to get one that is made completely different the next. They are also out of stuff ALL THE TIME. When I'm paying $12 for a medium black coffee and an egg sandwich it better be great.

I'll drive the extra mile to Starbucks from now on.
Good selection. Very Awesome attentive staff! Highly recommend asking the staff what they like. They have lots of input to offer.

I'm just leaving this place on a Sunday morning.  I thoroughly enjoyed my chai tea latte, was tempted to buy an egg sandwich because I know from experience they are delectable, relaxed a bit, and got all of my work done.  I love the atmosphere and the owner makes witty remarks!  This is my favorite coffee shop in Las Vegas.

This place is down the street from our house in Vegas. We decided to grab a couple coffee drinks through the drive thru before our trip back to Irvine.

First of all the variety and wide span of selection is awesome. Every choice was unique, which I'm always a sucker for. I wanted to try everything! I got the "Dirty Chai Latte" hot which is Chai with a shot of espresso. Delicious! My Husband got a cold "Date Night" which is Strawberry Chocolate coffee. Very different, I dig it.

As a die hard Starbucks junkie, I seldom stray, but since the one near my house is being renovated, what's a girl to do? Upon entering, I have to say I love the design of the store. It's cute and trendy for sure. Since it was my first time, I had the barista recommend me a drink, which was the Lunch Date. It wasn't bad, (chocolate and strawberry latte). It's definitely a shake up of my usual caramel macchiato. The service was good and the atmosphere was definitely legit. . They also have a loyalty punch card, buy 9 drinks get the 10th free which is pretty cool too. I'll be checking this place out again soon
O!M!G! Best breakfast sandwich I've ever had! Robin's nest! Lightly toasted pieces of toast filled with bacon, sautéed mushrooms and spinach, tomato, avocado, bacon and fried eggs. Deelish!!!!

Perk up coffee is so cute! Their dark roast black coffee with a splash of almond milk was a big pick me up. Their coffee is flavorful and not terrible like Starbucks hahahahaha. I'm also definitely digging their seasonal specials like their pumpkin spice drinks and their selection of hot teas.

(Now I work across the street) I eat from there almost everyday now because their turkey crossaint sandwiches make my life haha.

The interior is really upscale with a almost New York or Chicago feel . The prices however are pretty standard and I can't wait to try their food. The workers there are so friendly and are always smiling making it a positive environment
Love the staff as.they are so friendly and the coffee is good. The price is affordable. The owner is.always there and she is just.great. I love these.little mom and popp places. I recommend it.

Love this coffee shop. We come here often and the service is great. It always great to find your own local spot, and this is it for me and my family. Coffee is good Andy husband lives the pastries. Definitely come check it out.
Nice quiet place with friendly staff in a great location. The English Bulldog that often hangs out in front of the coffee shop some mornings is always a fun way to start your day also.
I was that obnoxious customer that asked for everything differently, and they were just so cool about it. Sandwich was good, coffee was good, overall excellent experience!
Such good coffee, very convenient location and great staff. Definitely support your local coffee shop!

Wow this is seriously the last time I come to the drive through at this place! I've been sitting here for over 15 minutes and still don't have my coffee!! I've never seen this coffee shop slammed once. Even if it was super busy there's no excuse to wait that long for a luke warm latte.  I pull up to the window and pay and am told that my drink hasn't even been started yet.  5 minutes after that I'm told they don't have the milk alternative I asked and paid for.   upon receiving my drink and informing the barista how long I've been waiting I'm given an excuse for how I'm not the only customer instead of an apology or a free drink for my trouble.  I am all about supporting local business and would rather go to a local spot than Starbucks. After this it experience I'm sure it would be faster and better service to wait in the 15 car line at the Starbucks down the street!!

This is one of those places where you it may be better the second time around.

On a quiet Sunday morning, my husband and I continued our LV coffee tour and visited Perk Up located in a small shopping strip in Southern Highlands.

We obviously came during a shift change.  I heard the barista on her cell phone tell someone that she was excited for her shift to be over. I get it - it was slow - there was only 2 other kids in the store and they didn't look old enough to spell coffee let alone drink coffee. There wasn't anyone at the counter when we arrived but it wasn't too long before someone took our order. I ordered an Iced Crème de Menthe latte and my husband ordered a hot Hazelnut latte. 

The service was pretty average at best and the drinks matched the mood. The prices are comparable to Starbucks. Nothing really stood out as far as memorable. I felt the coffee was too weak for my taste. My husband wasn't particularly fond of his latte either. He didn't finish it. I wish I had ordered drip coffee but it was an iced latte kind of day.
The positive was the store was clean. There was a bookshelf filled with different books and boardgames. There was a marble table that could seat 6 in the corner. That was a nice touch. There were random items on the wall held up by binder clips. There was a flat screen on the wall that wasn't turned on.

The 2 star "Meh, I've experienced better" caption perfectly captures our experience but on my rating scale... my first time here was a solid 3 out of 5.

What a lovely establishment! We came in looking for breakfast and tea and I'm pescatarian so it can be hard to find options. Genie was so, so helpful and nice, and she whipped me up a delicious sandwich and personalized it for my diet! And she gave really good tips about the tea selection and basically knew what I wanted even though I didn't haha. Definitely recommend! :)

This is a sweet little small business that gives Starbucks a run for its money! I was able to sneak here for a "mama break" and enjoy a dairyfree iced latte along with their eggs nest (bacon, eggs, veggies, with a special sauce on top of toast.) The simplicity is what I dug the most. 

Food: there was a great selection of snacks and brunch and lunch items to choose from. Most items are made to order so the small wait is worth it. The drinks are hand crafted and there's a choice for anyone who wants coffee or doesn't. 

Service: the staff was super friendly and welcoming.

Ambiance: there's a nook for everyone to hangout in or hide out in lol! I definitely see myself coming back to read a book or write blog posts in peace and quiet.

This is a small hidden gem of so high (southern highlands). Just like how this affluent neighborhood is growing, hopefully so does this business. 

You can find perk up coffee in a small, quaint strip mall that doesn't feel as cookie cutter and mainstream as other places would. The area gives it a little bit more of an authentic and unique feel. What adds to the uniqueness are their variety of specialty coffees. Their iced coffees are absolutely delicious and my boyfriend and I always get the Nutella and tira misu iced coffees. The staff are young, fun and friendly. 

Why I gave it 4 stars and not 5 is how it still gives you that start up business feel. They have a drive thru with this big beautiful menu and once you make it to the window you realize there's only one and you see this big sink behind it. I guess I'm not really sure if the cash register is right by the sink, but it just looked a little odd. Inside is cute and they have great seating areas and books for children to read, unfortunately I hardly see any people in there. To some a great thing to others, may look like their coffee isn't great because of the lack of business. 

Overall, great coffee, great staff and I hope a little bit more marketing goes a long way for this fine establishment. It deserves more hype than it gets!

A few days before our WordCamp Vegas event, our other coffee vendor bailed on us. We were able to get ahold of the owner and work something out. We showed up and they had everything ready for us. They truly helped us out and we plan on using them every year forward.

Food is good but ridiculously over priced. While waiting in the drive thru for about 10 minutes at the window, I looked up reviews to see what people were saying and saw another person experienced the same thing. Two sandwiches, two drinks and a nearly $30 total. For this price I could've easily gone to rise and shine down the street for a much better experience and a full meal other than a sandwich.

My go to early morning when I'm taking the kids to the park! Coffee is great and I love all the different options they offer. The only thing that makes me give it one less star, the service is extremely slow. Something they can improve on!

I have been looking for a clean, quiet coffee shop to enjoy a cappuccino, and Perk Up is just that. 

Agree with previous reviews that the food selection is sparse and the counter service just ok. But the shop is not a loud, dirty, messy daycare setting like the alternative, Holley's Cuppa. It's clean and comfortable. The menu has all the classic coffee drinks, but just doesn't have an authentic espresso flavor, overly sweet and completely room temp at best. Big waste of $5. 

We will not be back. The quality just isn't there and the service is beyond poor lately.

Definitely a quiet coffee shop but one of my favorite places to go! I normally do drove thru but wanted to escape a little bit and enjoy the quiet tranquil coffee shop vibe! This is a store run by a great manager, she is always chatting with customers and definitely is well known. I may have moved away from southern highlands for a little but I definitely won't stay away! Great coffee!

Found out about this place via the Yelp app on my phone, when Perk Up Coffee Shop turned out to be one of the closest places to get a fresh cop of java from where I live. The location is in a quiet little strip mall in Southern Highlands. There's shaded outdoor seating, which worked good even in the summer (in the mornings, that is). 

The inside is nice and cozy, and the shelves have board games that you can borrow while you visit. 

The staff was very friendly. Since it was my first time, I asked if they had any favorite drinks and they recommended I tried the Moroccan latte. I went for the cold version, and this was a delicious mix of chocolate, hazelnut and cinnamon. I would recommend it too, but it looks like they have a lot of different tasty drinks on the menu. 

Also went for the triple berry scone, which was nice and sweet. 

Will definitely come back here for a refill. Perk Up also has a drive thru.

Just moved to Southern Highlands and was hoping this would be our new neighborhood cafe. Definitely not. Took FOREVER for my latte to come out and they were not even busy. I actually thought they forgot about my drink order. Hubby said this is how slow it was the first time he came and he orders black coffee! Employees seem to be poorly trained. Even person taking drive-through orders seemed to be getting annoyed with the co-workers. Floors are dirty, I even saw a wad of gum and a q-tip behind the chairs in the front. Ewwwww....AND employees were just inappropriate. Apparently one of them has or had another job making $10 and she was the only person that spoke English there. Is this appropriate conversation? No thank you. We always try to support local businesses, and this cafe could be sooooo cute, after a DEEP cleaning and socially appropriate and much better trained employees. Drink was just ok, not impressive as well. Skip this place, just go to Starbucks down the street.

Located near Valley View and Southern Highland Parkway, it is definitely a decent substitute from Starbucks in the main plaza. 

They offer what you expect, coffees, lattes, and frappes.
For food, they have breakfast breads (croissants, scones, and such) and breakfast sandwiches.

I ordered 2 breakfast sandwiches and 2 regular sized iced coffees and my total was near ~$30.00. I do think it's a bit outrageous to spend ~$30 on breakfast for two people. Another thing I have to mention is that I came in around noon, and we were the only customer in the building and it still took a good 15-20 minutes for them to make 2 sandwiches and 2 iced drinks.

Although the staff was nice, I do believe that these guys have got to work faster, especially in a coffee shop! I do not like leaving negative reviews but with a little adjustment in price and sense of urgencies, I will definitely come back, but until then, I hope it gets better!

We came in for a quick breakfast. I got an iced frappe style drink which was good. My husband got a regular coffee and it was terrible. It tasted like it was watered down or something, just not right. Then we found a lot of grinds at the bottom of the cup, so I wonder if he just received a "bad batch" that had been brewed incorrectly somehow.

He got a bacon egg cheese on bagel and I got the same on a croissant. Both were ok. (I can't stand when bacon is soggy and chewy. It's a common occurrence at breakfast places but Sometimes I'm pleasantly surprised.)

The inside is standard cafe style with a variety of seating options depending on your mood. There's also bookshelf in the middle with a variety of books and board games for anyone to use.

May be a while before we try this place again and we'll only probably give it another shot because it's so close to home.

I love this place. It's my favorite coffee shop in Las Vegas. They have amazing and unique flavors which is perfect for when you want to mix it up every now and then. The service is great, too. I've never had any issue with the customer service, time it takes to get my order, or the coffee. In addition to being a cute place around my house, the quality of the coffee is fantastic and perfect every time.
